content.json: # Windows Update Compliance Dashboard --- An update compliance reporting solution for Windows client devices. Built by Jan Ketil Skanke, Sandy Zeng and Maurice Daly.

The purpose of this dashboard is to give you full oversight of your Windows client device patching health. This includes; 1. Patch compliance state over time 2. Feature update state, including support 3. Patch content source, and download figures per category 4. Patching issues reported **Note:** Values are based on information obtained from multiple logs. The source date entries are opposite ### ⚠ Important - Onboarding URL Documentation In order for clients to communicate with Microsoft telemtry services, please ensure that endpoints listed in the following documentation links are avaialble through your firewall / proxy servers; https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/privacy/manage-windows-1809-endpoints#windows-update
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/deployment/update/update-compliance-configuration-manual#required-endpoints
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/mem/intune/protect/windows-10-expedite-updates

content.query:
UCClient
| extend URL = "https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/azure-monitor/reference/tables/ucclientupdatestatus"
| summarize arg_max(TimeGenerated,Type, URL)
| extend LogDeltaCheck = iif(TimeGenerated > ago(3d),"Service OK","Service Issues")
| union (UCClientReadinessStatus
	| extend URL = "https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/azure-monitor/reference/tables/ucclientreadinessstatus"
    | summarize arg_max(TimeGenerated,Type,URL))
    | extend LogDeltaCheck = iif(TimeGenerated > ago(3d),"Service OK","Service Issues")
| union (UCClientUpdateStatus
	| extend URL = "https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/azure-monitor/reference/tables/ucclientupdatestatus"
    | summarize arg_max(TimeGenerated,Type,URL))
    | extend LogDeltaCheck = iif(TimeGenerated > ago(3d),"Service OK","Service Issues")
| union (UCDeviceAlert
	| extend URL = "https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/azure-monitor/reference/tables/ucdevicealert"
    | summarize arg_max(TimeGenerated,Type,URL))
    | extend LogDeltaCheck = iif(TimeGenerated > ago(3d),"Service OK","Service Issues")
| union (UCServiceUpdateStatus
	| extend URL = "https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/azure-monitor/reference/tables/ucserviceupdatestatus"
    | summarize arg_max(TimeGenerated,Type,URL))
    | extend LogDeltaCheck = iif(TimeGenerated > ago(3d),"Service OK","Service Issues")
| union (UCUpdateAlert
	| extend URL = "https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/azure-monitor/reference/tables/ucupdatealert"
    | summarize arg_max(TimeGenerated,Type,URL))  
    | extend LogDeltaCheck = iif(TimeGenerated > ago(3d),"Service OK","Service Issues")
| union (WaaSDeploymentStatus
	| extend URL = "https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/deployment/update/update-compliance-schema-waasdeploymentstatus"
    | summarize arg_max(TimeGenerated,Type,URL))
    | extend LogDeltaCheck = iif(TimeGenerated > ago(3d),"Service OK","Service Issues")
| union (WaaSUpdateStatus
	| extend URL = "https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/deployment/update/update-compliance-schema-waasupdatestatus"
    | summarize arg_max(TimeGenerated,Type,URL))
    | extend LogDeltaCheck = iif(TimeGenerated > ago(3d),"Service OK","Service Issues")
| union (WUDOAggregatedStatus
	| extend URL = "https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/deployment/update/update-compliance-schema-wudoaggregatedstatus"
    | summarize arg_max(TimeGenerated,Type,URL))
    | extend LogDeltaCheck = iif(TimeGenerated > ago(3d),"Service OK","Service Issues")
| union (WUDOStatus
	| extend URL = "https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/deployment/update/update-compliance-schema-wudostatus"
    | summarize arg_max(TimeGenerated,Type,URL))
    | extend LogDeltaCheck = iif(TimeGenerated > ago(3d),"Service OK","Service Issues")
| where isnotempty(Type)
| project Type, TimeGenerated, URL, LogDeltaCheck
| sort by TimeGenerated, LogDeltaCheck

parameters.name: ActiveClientCount
parameters.label: Active Client Count
parameters.query:
IntuneDevices
| where OS == "Windows"
| where todatetime(LastContact) > ago (30d)
| distinct DeviceId
| summarize count()
| project toint(count_)

parameters.name: PatchingThreshold
parameters.label: Patching Threshold
parameters.query:
IntuneDevices
| where OS == "Windows"
| where todatetime(LastContact) > ago (30d)
| distinct DeviceId
| summarize count()
| extend Threshold = toint(count_)*95/100
| project toint(Threshold)

parameters.name: CustomHWLogs

search "*" | distinct $table
| extend HWLogsAvailable = iif ($table contains "DeviceInventory","True","False")
| where HWLogsAvailable == "True"
| summarize count()
| extend Available = iif (count_ > 0,"True","False")
| project Available

parameters.name: ApplicationLogs

search "*" | distinct $table
| extend HWLogsAvailable = iif ($table contains "AppInventory","True","False")

| summarize count()
| extend Available = iif (count_ > 0,"True","False")
| project Available

Windows Update for Business is reporting that not all of your devices are registered. This can be due to your update workload configuration, and/or retired devices in your environment.

content.json:
### Patch Restart Requirement
Windows and application patches require a restart in order to apply the updated files. Due to this, uptime of Windows devices should be monitored, and instructions relayed to staff to ensure they do not cause security issues running a device in sleep mode for extended periods as opposed to shutting down / restarting.

content.query:
DeviceInventory_CL 
| project TimeGenerated, ComputerName_s, ComputerUpTime_s
| sort by ComputerUpTime_s desc
| summarize round((avg(toint(ComputerUpTime_s))))
| extend Type = "Average Uptime"

DeviceInventory_CL 
| project TimeGenerated, ComputerName_s, ComputerUpTime_s
| summarize toint(max(ComputerUpTime_s))
| extend Type = "Longest Uptime"

content.query:
UCUpdateAlert 
| summarize arg_max(TimeGenerated, *) by Recommendation, AzureADDeviceId
| where isnotempty(DeviceName) and isnotempty(Recommendation)
| extend IssueDescription = iif(Recommendation contains "internet","Connectivity Issue",iff(Recommendation contains "conflict","Conflict",iif(Recommendation contains "Support","Support Issue",iif(Recommendation contains "SetupDiag","Compatibility Issue",""))))
| summarize dcount(AzureADDeviceId) by Recommendation, IssueDescription
| project dcount_AzureADDeviceId, IssueDescription

UCClient
| project TimeGenerated, AzureADDeviceId, OSSecurityUpdateStatus
| extend TimeRounded = bin(TimeGenerated, 1d)
| summarize arg_max(TimeRounded, *) by TimeRounded,AzureADDeviceId, OSSecurityUpdateStatus
//| make-series ComputerCount = count(AzureADDeviceId) default = 0 on TimeRounded from {TimeRange:start} to {TimeRange:end} step {TimeRange:grain} by OSSecurityUpdateStatus
| summarize ComputerCount = dcount(AzureADDeviceId,4) by TimeGenerated, OSSecurityUpdateStatus
content.title: Quality Update Patch Trend

content.query:
UCClientUpdateStatus
| where  ClientState == "Installed" and isnotempty( TargetKBNumber)
| where UpdateCategory == "WindowsQualityUpdate" and UpdateClassification == "Security"
| join kind=rightouter (IntuneDevices
| where OS == "Windows"
| where todatetime(LastContact) > ago (30d)
| distinct ReferenceId)
on $left.AzureADDeviceId == $right.ReferenceId
| where bin(UpdateInstalledTime, 1d) > {TimeRange:start}
| extend TimeRounded = bin(TimeGenerated, 1d)
| summarize arg_max(TimeRounded, *) by TimeRounded,AzureADDeviceId, TargetKBNumber
| make-series ComputerCount = count(AzureADDeviceId) default = 0 on TimeRounded from {TimeRange:start} to {TimeRange:end} step {TimeRange:grain} by TargetKBNumber
//| summarize ComputerCount = dcount(AzureADDeviceId,4) by bin (TimeGenerated, 1d), TargetKBNumber
content.title: Successful Quality Update Installs - Per Day

content.query:
let UpdateData = WaaSDeploymentStatus 
| where UpdateCategory == "Quality" and UpdateClassification == "Security" and UpdateReleasedDate between (ago(60d) .. now())
| distinct ReleaseName, UpdateReleasedDate, TargetOSVersion;
WaaSDeploymentStatus
| where UpdateCategory == "Quality" and UpdateClassification == "Security" and ReleaseName in (UpdateData)
| where isnotempty(UpdateReleasedDate)
| where isnotempty(Computer) and Computer != "#"
| extend DeploymentState = iff((DetailedStatus == "Update successful" or DetailedStatus == "UpdateSuccessful"),"Update Successful", DetailedStatus)
| extend SummaryState = iff((DeploymentState == "Update Successful"),"Installed","Not Installed")
| where DeploymentState != "NotStarted"
| where SummaryState == "Not Installed" 
| summarize arg_max(TimeGenerated, *) by ComputerID, ReleaseName, SummaryState
| join kind=leftouter (UCClientUpdateStatus
//| where TimeGenerated between (ago(30d) .. now())
| distinct GlobalDeviceId, AzureADDeviceId)
on $left.ComputerID == $right.GlobalDeviceId
| join kind=leftouter (IntuneDevices
| summarize arg_max(TimeGenerated,*) by ReferenceId)
on $left.AzureADDeviceId == $right.ReferenceId
| extend Active = iff( (todatetime(LastContact) between (ago(30d) .. now() )), "Active", "Inactive" )
| where Active == "Active"
//| project TimeGenerated, DeploymentState
| extend TimeRounded = bin(TimeGenerated, 1d)
| summarize arg_max(TimeRounded, *) by TimeRounded, AzureADDeviceId, DeploymentState
| make-series ComputerCount = count(Computer) default = 0 on TimeRounded from {TimeRange:start} to {TimeRange:end} step {TimeRange:grain} by DeploymentState
//| summarize dcount(Computer,2) by DeploymentState, TimeGenerated
content.title: Patch Installation State

content.query:
UCClientUpdateStatus
| where UpdateCategory == "WindowsQualityUpdate" and UpdateClassification == "Security" and  UpdateReleaseTime > {TimeRange:start}
| summarize arg_max(TimeGenerated, *) by AzureADDeviceId, UpdateReleaseTime
| extend SummaryState = iff((ClientSubstate == "UpdateInstalled"),"Patched","Not Patched")
| join kind=innerunique 
    (IntuneDevices
    | where OS contains "Windows"
    | where todatetime(LastContact) > ago (30d)
    | summarize arg_max(TimeGenerated, *) by ReferenceId
    ) on $left.AzureADDeviceId == $right.ReferenceId 
| summarize count() by SummaryState

content.query:
UCClient

content.json:
----
## Quality Update Deployment details by Updates

Quality updates deliver both security and non-security fixes to Windows 10. Quality updates include security updates, critical updates, servicing stack updates, and driver updates. They are typically released on the second Tuesday of each month, though they can be released at any time. The second-Tuesday releases are the ones that focus on security updates. Quality updates are cumulative, so installing the latest quality update is sufficient to get all the available fixes for a specific Windows 10 feature update, including any out-of-band security fixes and any servicing stack updates that might have been released previously.

More information can be found here - https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/deployment/update/get-started-updates-channels-tools

parameters.name: ReleaseName
parameters.label: QualityUpdate
parameters.query:
WaaSDeploymentStatus
| where UpdateCategory == "Quality" and UpdateClassification == "Security"
| where isnotempty(UpdateReleasedDate ) and isnotempty(Computer)
//| summarize Count = count() by ReleaseName, UpdateReleasedDate
| project Value = ReleaseName, Label = strcat(OSVersion, ' - ', ReleaseName, ' - ',  format_datetime(UpdateReleasedDate,'yyyy/MM/dd'))
| distinct Value, Label
| sort by Label desc

content.query:
WaaSDeploymentStatus
| extend DetailedStatus = case(DetailedStatus == 'Update successful', 'UpdateSuccessful', DetailedStatus)
| where UpdateCategory == "Quality" and UpdateClassification == "Security"
| where ReleaseName in ({ReleaseName}) or '*' in ({ReleaseName})
| project TimeGenerated, ReleaseName, DetailedStatus, Computer
| summarize count () by TimeGenerated, ReleaseName, DetailedStatus

let data = WaaSDeploymentStatus
    | extend DetailedStatus = case(DetailedStatus == 'Update successful', 'UpdateSuccessful', DetailedStatus)
    | summarize arg_max(TimeGenerated, *) by ComputerID, ReleaseName
    | where UpdateCategory == "Quality" and UpdateClassification == "Security"
    | where ReleaseName in ({ReleaseName}) or '*' in ({ReleaseName})
    | project TimeGenerated, ReleaseName, DetailedStatus, Computer;
data
| summarize DeviceCount = count () by DetailedStatus
| union (data
    | summarize DeviceCount = count()
    | extend DetailedStatus = 'Total'
) 
| order by DeviceCount desc
| extend butonText = 'deployment'
content.title: Deployment Overview

content.query:
WaaSDeploymentStatus
| extend DetailedStatus = case(DetailedStatus == 'Update successful', 'UpdateSuccessful', DetailedStatus)
| where UpdateCategory == "Quality" and UpdateClassification == "Security"
| where isnotempty(UpdateReleasedDate)
| where isnotempty (Computer)
| where ReleaseName in ({ReleaseName}) or '*' in ({ReleaseName})
| summarize arg_max(TimeGenerated, *) by Computer, ReleaseName
| where DetailedStatus == "{DetailedStatus}" or "{DetailedStatus}" == "Total"
| project  TimeGenerated, LastScan, Computer, DeploymentStatus, DetailedStatus, DeploymentError, CurrentOSVersion = OSVersion, CurrentOSBuild = OSBuild, ReleaseName, UpdateReleasedDate, DeferralDays, PauseState, ExpectedInstallDate
| sort by UpdateReleasedDate, Computer desc
content.title: DetailedStatus - {DetailedStatus}

content.query:
let UpdateData = WaaSDeploymentStatus
| where UpdateCategory == "Quality" and UpdateClassification == "Security"
| where ReleaseName in ({ReleaseName}) or '*' in ({ReleaseName})
| where isnotempty(UpdateReleasedDate)
| where isnotempty (Computer)
| extend ReleaseName = strcat(OSVersion, ' - ', ReleaseName, ' - ', format_datetime(UpdateReleasedDate, 'yyyy/MM/dd'))
| summarize arg_max(TimeGenerated, *) by Computer, ReleaseName
| project ReleaseName, DeploymentStatus;
UpdateData
| summarize Total = count () by ReleaseName
| join kind=fullouter UpdateData on ReleaseName
| project ReleaseName, DeploymentStatus, Total
| evaluate pivot(DeploymentStatus)
| extend ['Update completed'] = column_ifexists('Update completed', 0 )
| extend SuccessRate = (['Update completed'] * 100 / Total) // Calculate the percentage of succesful operations against the total
| project-reorder SuccessRate
| order by ReleaseName
content.title: All Deployment details

content.json:
----
## Quality Update Deployment details by Device

Quality updates deliver both security and non-security fixes to Windows 10. Quality updates include security updates, critical updates, servicing stack updates, and driver updates. They are typically released on the second Tuesday of each month, though they can be released at any time. The second-Tuesday releases are the ones that focus on security updates. Quality updates are cumulative, so installing the latest quality update is sufficient to get all the available fixes for a specific Windows 10 feature update, including any out-of-band security fixes and any servicing stack updates that might have been released previously.

More information can be found here - https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/deployment/update/get-started-updates-channels-tools

content.query:
let data = WaaSDeploymentStatus
    | extend DetailedStatus = case(DetailedStatus == 'Update successful', 'UpdateSuccessful', DetailedStatus)
    | summarize arg_max(TimeGenerated, *) by ComputerID, ReleaseName, DetailedStatus
    | where UpdateCategory == "Quality" and UpdateClassification == "Security"
    | where "{DeviceName:escape}" == "*" or Computer contains "{DeviceName:escape}" or "{DeviceName:escape}" == "All devices"
    | project TimeGenerated, ReleaseName, DetailedStatus, Computer;
data
| summarize DeviceCount = count () by DetailedStatus
| union (data
    | summarize DeviceCount = count()
    | extend DetailedStatus = 'Total'
) 
| order by DeviceCount desc
| extend butonText = 'Deployment(s)'
content.title: Deployment Overview

content.query:
WaaSDeploymentStatus
| extend DetailedStatus = case(DetailedStatus == 'Update successful', 'UpdateSuccessful', DetailedStatus)
| where UpdateCategory == "Quality" and UpdateClassification == "Security"
| where isnotempty(UpdateReleasedDate)
| where isnotempty (Computer)
| where "{DeviceName:escape}" == "*" or Computer contains "{DeviceName:escape}" or "{DeviceName:escape}" == "All devices"
| summarize arg_max(TimeGenerated, *) by Computer, ReleaseName, DetailedStatus
| where DetailedStatus == "{DetailedStatus}" or "{DetailedStatus}" == "Total"
| extend KBNumber = (split(ReleaseName," ")[0])
| extend MSSupportURL = strcat("https://support.microsoft.com/KB/", KBNumber)
| project  TimeGenerated, LastScan, Computer, DeploymentStatus, DetailedStatus, DeploymentError, CurrentOSVersion = OSVersion, CurrentOSBuild = OSBuild, ReleaseName, UpdateReleasedDate, DeferralDays, PauseState, ExpectedInstallDate, MSSupportURL
| sort by UpdateReleasedDate, Computer desc
content.title: DetailedStatus - {DetailedStatus}

content.query:
let UpdateData = WaaSDeploymentStatus
| where UpdateCategory == "Quality" and UpdateClassification == "Security"
| where "{DeviceName:escape}" == "*" or Computer contains "{DeviceName:escape}" or "{DeviceName:escape}" == "All devices"
| where isnotempty(UpdateReleasedDate)
| where isnotempty (Computer)
| extend ReleaseName = strcat(OSVersion, ' - ', ReleaseName, ' - ', format_datetime(UpdateReleasedDate, 'yyyy/MM/dd'))
| summarize arg_max(TimeGenerated, *) by Computer, ReleaseName
| project ReleaseName, DeploymentStatus;
UpdateData
| summarize Total = count () by ReleaseName
| join kind=fullouter UpdateData on ReleaseName
| project ReleaseName, DeploymentStatus, Total
| evaluate pivot(DeploymentStatus)
| extend ['Update completed'] = column_ifexists('Update completed', 0 )
| extend SuccessRate = (['Update completed'] * 100 / Total) // Calculate the percentage of succesful operations against the total
| project-reorder SuccessRate
| order by ReleaseName
content.title: All Deployment details

content.json:
# Feature Updates
-----

Feature updates for Windows 10 are released twice a year, around March and September, via the Semi-Annual Channel. They will be serviced with monthly quality updates for 18 or 30 months from the date of the release, depending on the lifecycle policy.

More information can be found here - https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/release-health/release-information

parameters.name: ReleaseName
parameters.query:
WaaSUpdateStatus
| distinct OSVersion
| sort by OSVersion desc

content.query:
let WindowsBuilds1 = UCClient
| where TimeGenerated > ago (30d)
| extend var_OSBuild = tostring( extract_all(@"(10.0.[0-9]*)", OSBuild)[0])
| extend OSVersion = case(isempty(OSVersion), strcat("Windows Insider Program"), OSVersion !has "Windows", strcat("Windows 10-", OSVersion), OSVersion )
| extend var_OSVersion = replace_string(OSVersion, "version_ ", "")
| distinct var_OSVersion, var_OSBuild;
let WindowsBuilds2 = UCClientUpdateStatus
| where TimeGenerated > ago (180d)
| distinct TargetVersion, TargetBuild
| extend var_OSBuild = tostring( extract_all(@"(10.0.[0-9]*)", TargetBuild)[0])
| extend var_OSVersion = case(TargetVersion has "Win11", replace_string(TargetVersion, "Win11", "Windows 11"), TargetVersion !has "Windows", strcat("Windows 10-", TargetVersion), TargetVersion )
| distinct var_OSVersion, var_OSBuild;
let WindowsBuilds = WindowsBuilds1
| union WindowsBuilds2
| distinct var_OSBuild, var_OSVersion;
IntuneDevices
| where todatetime(LastContact) > ago(30d) and OS contains "Windows"
| summarize arg_max(TimeGenerated, *) by ReferenceId
| extend var_OSBuild = tostring( extract_all(@"(10.0.[0-9]{5})", OSVersion)[0])
| join kind=leftouter (WindowsBuilds
    )
    on var_OSBuild
| extend OSBuild = OSVersion
| extend OSVersion= var_OSVersion
| project bin(TimeGenerated,1d), DeviceName, UPN, Manufacturer, SkuFamily, OSBuild, OSVersion, DeviceId, ReferenceId
| where isnotempty(OSVersion)
| join kind=leftouter (UCClient
| summarize arg_max(TimeGenerated, *) by AzureADDeviceId
| project AzureADDeviceId, OSFeatureUpdateStatus
    )
    on $left.ReferenceId == $right.AzureADDeviceId
| summarize arg_max(TimeGenerated,*) by ReferenceId
| where isnotempty(OSFeatureUpdateStatus)
| summarize dcount(DeviceId) by OSFeatureUpdateStatus
content.title: Windows Supported Build Count

| distinct var_OSVersion, var_OSBuild;
let WindowsBuilds = WindowsBuilds1
| union WindowsBuilds2
| distinct var_OSBuild, var_OSVersion;
IntuneDevices
| where todatetime(LastContact) > ago(30d) and OS contains "Windows"
| summarize arg_max(TimeGenerated, *) by ReferenceId
| extend var_OSBuild = tostring( extract_all(@"(10.0.[0-9]{5})", OSVersion)[0])

| extend OSBuild = OSVersion

| project bin(TimeGenerated,1d), DeviceName, UPN, Manufacturer, SkuFamily, OSBuild, OSVersion, DeviceId
| where isnotempty(OSVersion)
| summarize arg_max(TimeGenerated,*) by DeviceId

content.query:
let data = WaaSDeploymentStatus
    | extend DetailedStatus = case(DetailedStatus == 'Update successful', 'UpdateSuccessful', DetailedStatus)
    | summarize arg_max(TimeGenerated, *) by ComputerID, ReleaseName
    | where UpdateCategory == "Feature"
    | where ReleaseName in ({ReleaseName}) or '*' in ({ReleaseName})

# Patch Alerting
-----

Please pay attention to this section for machines which are flagged for warning based on the following values

1. Last Scan Date
2. Missing Security Updates
3. Unsupported Windows Builds

### PrintNightmare Patch Monitor
________________________
More information on this CVE and assoicated OOB updates can be found here - https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2021-34527

content.query:
WaaSDeploymentStatus
| where TimeGenerated > ago (90d)
| where UpdateCategory == "Quality" and UpdateClassification == "Security"
| where ReleaseName matches regex "(KB5004946|KB5004945|KB5004245|KB5004237)"
| where isnotempty(UpdateReleasedDate)
| where isnotempty (Computer)
| summarize dcount(Computer) by TimeGenerated, DeploymentStatus

WaaSDeploymentStatus
| where TimeGenerated > ago (90d)
| where UpdateCategory == "Quality" and UpdateClassification == "Security"
| where ReleaseName matches regex "(KB5004946|KB5004945|KB5004245|KB5004237)"
| where isnotempty(UpdateReleasedDate)
| where isnotempty (Computer)
| extend ReleaseName = strcat(OSVersion, ' - ', ReleaseName, ' - ', format_datetime(UpdateReleasedDate, 'yyyy/MM/dd'))
| summarize arg_max(UpdateReleasedDate, *) by Computer, ReleaseName
| summarize TotalRuns = count(), Success = countif(DeploymentStatus == 'Update completed'), Fails = countif(DeploymentStatus == 'Failed'), Unknown = countif(DeploymentStatus == 'Unknown'), ['In progress'] = countif(DeploymentStatus == 'In progress'), ['Progress stalled'] = countif(DeploymentStatus == 'Progress stalled') by ReleaseName // Summarize the total, successful and failed operations by name
| extend SuccessRate = (Success * 100 / TotalRuns) // Calculate the percentage of succesful operations against the total
| project ReleaseName, TotalRuns, ["Success"] = Success, ["Fails"] = Fails, Unknown, ['In progress'], ['Progress stalled'], SuccessRate
| order by ReleaseName

The below statistics show the sources for update content across all devices. Downloads from the CDN and peers are determined by delivery optimisation policies on your clients. 

More information on delivery optimisation can be found here - https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/deployment/update/waas-delivery-optimization

## Delivery Optimization Network Breakdown

Custom hardware logs are available, and below is a breakdown of content distribution per subnet.

content.query:
WUDOStatus 
| join kind=innerunique    
    (UCClient
    | project GlobalDeviceId, AzureADDeviceId
    ) on $left.ComputerID == $right.GlobalDeviceId
| join kind=innerunique 
    (IntuneDevices
    | project ReferenceId, DeviceId
    ) on $left.AzureADDeviceId == $right.ReferenceId
| join kind=innerunique 
    (DeviceInventory_CL
    ) on $left.DeviceId == $right.ManagedDeviceID_g
| where isnotempty(tostring(parse_json(NetworkAdapters_s)[(0)].NetIPv4DefaultGateway))
| summarize sum(BytesFromPeers), sum(BytesFromCDN), sum(PeersSuccessCount), sum(PeersCannotConnectCount) by tostring(parse_json(NetworkAdapters_s)[0].NetIPv4DefaultGateway)
| order by sum_BytesFromPeers desc
| extend Total = (sum_BytesFromPeers + sum_BytesFromCDN)
| extend CDNPercent = (todouble(sum_BytesFromCDN) * 100 / todouble(Total)) , PeerPercent = (todouble(sum_BytesFromPeers) * 100 / todouble(Total))
| project ["Network Gateway"] = NetworkAdapters_s_0_NetIPv4DefaultGateway, ["Peer Connections"] = sum_PeersSuccessCount, ["Peer Errors"] = sum_PeersCannotConnectCount, ["GB from Peers"] = sum_BytesFromPeers, ["GB from CDN"] = sum_BytesFromCDN, ["Peer Percentage"] = PeerPercent, ["CDN Percentage"] = CDNPercent
| order by ["GB from Peers"] desc
content.title: Delivery Optimization By IP Range

| summarize ["CDN Percentage"] = avg(todecimal(round((CDNDistributionPercentage),1))), ["Peer Percentage"] = avg(todecimal(round((PeerDistributionPercentage),1)))

content.json:
## Bandwidth Savings - Optimal

Your delivery optimization settings are working very well, and you have significant volumes of traffic using peer to peer distribution.

## Bandwidth Savings - Good

Your delivery optimization settings are working, and you have a good level of traffic using peer to peer distribution.

## Bandwidth Savings - Poor

Delivery optimization levels show that your clients are sharing content, but the level of peer to peer sharing could be improved.

**Recommendation:** Please review your firewall configuration and delivery optimization URL access.

## Bandwidth Savings - Bad

Delivery optimization levels show that your clients are not sharing any significent content via peer to peer communications,

**Recommendation:** Please review your firewall configuration and delivery optimization URL access.

**Note** - If you are using cloud only clients with physical location seperation, this is expected and you can ignore this warning.

parameters.name: MissingPatches
parameters.query:
let UpdateData = WaaSDeploymentStatus 
| where UpdateCategory == "Quality" and UpdateClassification == "Security" and UpdateReleasedDate between (ago(60d) .. now())
| distinct ReleaseName, UpdateReleasedDate, TargetOSVersion;
WaaSDeploymentStatus
| where UpdateCategory == "Quality" and UpdateClassification == "Security" and ReleaseName in (UpdateData)
| where isnotempty(UpdateReleasedDate)
| where isnotempty(Computer) and Computer != "#"
| extend DeploymentState = iff((DetailedStatus == "Update successful" or DetailedStatus == "UpdateSuccessful"),"Update Successful", DetailedStatus)
| extend SummaryState = iff((DeploymentState == "Update Successful"),"Patched","Not Patched")
| summarize arg_max(TimeGenerated, *) by ComputerID, ReleaseName, SummaryState
| join kind=leftouter (UCClientUpdateStatus
| where TimeGenerated between (ago(30d) .. now())
| distinct GlobalDeviceId, AzureADDeviceId)
on $left.ComputerID == $right.GlobalDeviceId
| join kind=leftouter (IntuneDevices
| summarize arg_max(TimeGenerated,*) by ReferenceId)
on $left.AzureADDeviceId == $right.ReferenceId
| extend Active = iff( (todatetime(LastContact) between (ago(30d) .. now() )), "Active", "Inactive" )
| summarize arg_max(TimeGenerated, *) by ReleaseName, AzureADDeviceId
| where Active == "Active" and SummaryState == "Not Patched" and DetailedStatus != "NotStarted"
| summarize count()
| extend MissingPatches = iif(count_ > 0,"True","False")
| project MissingPatches

IntuneDevices

| where UpdateCategory == "WindowsFeatureUpdate"
| extend TargetVersion = case (isempty(TargetVersion), "Unknown TargetVersion", TargetVersion startswith "Win", TargetVersion, strcat("Windows 10-", TargetVersion))

content.json:
## Feature Update Policy Issues

Devices listed in the below grid currently have no feature update policy in effect. This could be due to issues with device registration with the Windows Update telemetry service.

## Feature Update Policy Issues

No feature update policy assignemt issues at present.

content.query:
IntuneDevices
| where OS == "Windows"
| where todatetime(LastContact) > ago (30d)
| distinct ReferenceId
| join kind=innerunique (UCUpdateAlert
| where UpdateCategory == "WindowsFeatureUpdate"
| extend TargetVersion = case (isempty(TargetVersion), "Unknown TargetVersion", TargetVersion startswith "Win", TargetVersion, strcat("Windows 10-", TargetVersion))
| extend DeploymentName = strcat(TargetVersion, " (", DeploymentId, ")")
| project TimeGenerated, DeploymentName, AzureADDeviceId, ServiceSubstate, ClientSubstate, StartTime, ResolvedTime, AlertStatus
| where isnotempty(StartTime)
)
on $left.ReferenceId == $right.AzureADDeviceId
| where ServiceSubstate == "RemovedFromDeployment" or ClientSubstate == "RemovedFromDeployment"
| project TimeGenerated, AzureADDeviceId, DeploymentName, ServiceSubstate, StartTime, ResolvedTime
| summarize arg_min(TimeGenerated,*) by AzureADDeviceId, DeploymentName, ServiceSubstate, StartTime, ResolvedTime
| mv-expand TimeRange = range(bin(StartTime, 1d), ResolvedTime , 1d)
| summarize DeviceCount = count() by bin(todatetime(TimeRange),1d), DeploymentName
| as Results
| make-series SumCount = sum(DeviceCount) default=0 on TimeRange in range(toscalar(Results | summarize min(TimeRange)), now(), 1d) by DeploymentName
| render timechart
content.title: Trending - Feature Update Policy Issues

content.query:

UCClientUpdateStatus

on $left.AzureADDeviceId == $right.ReferenceId

| order by TimeGenerated desc

content.json:
## Safeguard Hold Detected Safeguard holds prevent a device with a known issue from being offered a new operating system version. Microsoft uses quality and compatibility data to identify issues that might cause a Windows client feature update to fail or roll back. When we find such an issue, we might apply safeguard holds to the updating service to prevent affected devices from installing the update in order to safeguard them from these experiences. We also use safeguard holds when a customer, a partner, or Microsoft internal validation finds an issue that would cause severe impact (for example, rollback of the update, data loss, loss of connectivity, or loss of key functionality) and when a workaround is not immediately available. More information can be found here - https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/deployment/update/safeguard-holds
The Windows Health Dashboard could also contains information on Safeguard holds - https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/release-health/

## Safeguard Hold Issues

No safeguard holds have been detected.

content.query:
WaaSDeploymentStatus
    | extend DetailedStatus = case(DetailedStatus == 'Update successful', 'UpdateSuccessful', DetailedStatus)
    | summarize arg_max(TimeGenerated, *) by ComputerID, ReleaseName
    | where UpdateCategory == "Feature"
    | where DetailedStatus == "Safeguard Hold"
    | summarize dcount (Computer) by DetailedStatus, TimeGenerated
    | project dcount_Computer, TimeGenerated

WaaSDeploymentStatus
    | extend DetailedStatus = case(DetailedStatus == 'Update successful', 'UpdateSuccessful', DetailedStatus)
    | summarize arg_max(TimeGenerated, *) by ComputerID, ReleaseName
    | where UpdateCategory == "Feature"
    | where DetailedStatus == "Safeguard Hold"
| project TimeGenerated, Computer, OSVersion, DetailedStatus, DeploymentStatus, DeploymentError, DeploymentErrorCode

content.json:
--------

## Quality Update History

This tab displays Windows client updates per build of Windows 10/11 within monthly deployment cycles, including the success and failure rates per KB.

### Critial Security Updates - By Age
-------

content.query:
let UpdateData = WaaSDeploymentStatus
| where UpdateCategory == "Quality" and UpdateClassification == "Security"
| where isnotempty(UpdateReleasedDate)
| where UpdateReleasedDate  between (ago(30d) .. now() )
| where isnotempty (Computer)
| extend KBNumber = (split(ReleaseName," ")[0])
| extend ReleaseName = strcat(OSVersion, ' - ', ReleaseName, ' - ', format_datetime(UpdateReleasedDate, 'yyyy/MM/dd'))
| summarize arg_max(TimeGenerated, *) by Computer, ReleaseName
| project ReleaseName, DeploymentStatus, KBNumber;
UpdateData
| summarize Total = count () by ReleaseName
| join kind=fullouter UpdateData on ReleaseName
| project ReleaseName, DeploymentStatus, KBNumber, Total
| evaluate pivot(DeploymentStatus)
| extend ['Update completed'] = column_ifexists('Update completed', 0 )
| extend SuccessRate = (['Update completed'] * 100 / Total) // Calculate the percentage of succesful operations against the total
| extend ["Support URL"] = strcat("https://support.microsoft.com/KB/", KBNumber)
| project-away KBNumber
| project-reorder SuccessRate
| order by ReleaseName
content.title: Updates 0-30 Days

content.json:
## Microsoft 365 Apps for Enterprise

In this tab you have a consolidated view of your Microsoft 365 Apps for Enterprise build numbers, across all of your Intune managed Windows 10/11 devices. Information on the current latest builds can be found in the Microsoft Docs - https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/officeupdates/update-history-microsoft365-apps-by-date

## Microsoft Edge Updates Below is a full break down of the versions of Microsoft Edge and the device count against each version. Release notes and latest version information can be found here - https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/deployedge/microsoft-edge-relnote-stable-channel

content.query:
AppInventory_CL 
| where AppName_s contains "Microsoft 365"
| summarize arg_max(TimeGenerated, *) by ManagedDeviceID_g
| join kind=innerunique 
    (IntuneDevices
    | where todatetime(LastContact) > ago (30d)
    | summarize arg_max(TimeGenerated, *) by DeviceId
    ) on $left.ManagedDeviceID_g == $right.DeviceId 
| summarize dcount(ManagedDeviceID_g,2) by AppVersion_s
| order by AppVersion_s desc
content.title: Microsoft 365 Apps for Enterprise - By Build
